The game received many much needed QoL changes: You finally have some basic controls of your army, and no longer need to click once a time to boost your generals loyalties, and the annual martial arts competition from previous iterations makes a return, etc.  It's still a far cry from 7, but if you can find the game on sale or love the series, get it for nostalgia's sake.

Original review below for reference.

Sadly the game is unplayable in its current state.

1. Rigged AI:
AI knows the army size in your city and you get ganged by multiple sides at once (and no, sweeping your city for spies makes no difference).  Foreign  lords opinions  (å‹å¥½åº¦) mean nothing because they still attack you when it's 80+.  Some also extort you for money and attack less than 15min into a new campaign if you start with a weak side.  It doesn't matter which scenario you choose.  The AI disregard history and fight among themselves, in the Anti Dong Zhuo Alliance, for example.

2. Mechanics:
You need to micro-manage each general in battles to be effective, but the game makes it very difficult to do so.  In battle, your army starts charging right away, ruining your formation.  Also, you can pretty much cheese the game by just running around on a fast horse and spam skills.  Liu Bei also has a skill that auto captures every enemy general around him.  Talk about being lazy...

To level up your soldiers, you must use food/provisions.  The required amount reaches astronomical numbers later on. lvl 9 to 10: 55k.  Imagine reaching max lvl of 25?  It's almost a mobile cash grab system.

You can spend an entire season searching for generals and not able to find anyone (this is in the 2 earliest scenarios, even with the personal skill that makes finding generals easier).

If you have only 1 city, you HAVE TO leave someone behind.  It's game over if you lose your last city, even if you escape from battle.

3. Layout:
The menu layout does not make sense.  If I hit "Recruit", I'm not able to see my captives: The proper option is under the main menu tab which you cannot see unless you zoom out of your city.  The option to change your army type is hidden among a convoluted menu tree.  There is also no way to rotate the world map, making it awkward to travel to some spots.

4. Bugs?
The starting generals have random and different battle skills in different playthroughs, so do other lords' opinion of you.  Is this intentional?

After a decade since the 7th game's release, it's back. Fully on 3D as the entire game engine has been revamp. While the game's not in english, I have played games based on Three Kingdoms with basic knowledge of chinese characters. Userjoy spend two days working on post launch patches,  but people are mixed over the changes made since the 4th game(The fourth game suffers poor execution in changing the gameplay). My reception in this game is mostly positive honestly. But, some expect more after the tremendous job Creative Assembly did with Total War: Three Kingdoms.  Sanguo Heroes is more of a StrategyRPG than Grand Strategy. The focus is entirely on the action instead of dynasty simulator. Here's what you can do:

1. Explore China or it's bordering neighbors Korea, Japan, or Burma to search for bosses, draftees, etc.

2. Form allies or ceasefires. If you have more than 3 allies with the same larger enemy initiate a coalition.

3. Customize your city interiors by setting different building combination.

You can even wander around the sea, but that will drain alot of provisions. I didn't like how ROTK 14 cuts off Korea and Japan on the map, but you can view and explore them in this game.

Since post launch, the tutorial bug been patched and there were players who couldn't start the game normally like my copy does. Just remember, some most highly acclaimed games suffer launch problems. It's not worst than *cough* Cyberpunk 2077 *cough* Userjoy cares alot about this game so I'll look forward to more updates and hopefully they'll add the ability to marry female officers, return of  duel tournaments, and more scenarios. I'm surprised the standard game's price is 30 bucks on steam, but I really want a digital collector's edition with the artbook on pdf is that too much to ask? I recommend you play the classic seven games before trying the eighth installment out. =)

If you like age of empires and the previous versions of this game, then you will most likely enjoy this version. They didn't just update the graphics, the whole dynamic changed a bit in terms of engaging a battle, using gold, and number of forces. In the previous version, the gold system didn't really make much sense, you can attack enemy territory whenever you want, move resources freely, but this game makes you more aware and cautious about how you use these resources. Overall, I didn't want them changing much from the previous version but I wanted them to bring some surprises to people that are very familiar to this series and they didn't disappoint!

The game plays differently from previous iterations and the graphics are good improvements.

        I don't recommend the reviews from players who only played for a short time and simply get overwhelmed by expectations. There is always some sort of learning curve to a new system and game mechanics. The Dev should definitely have opened a demo version as most of the negative reviews are based on their first impression and a subpar tutorial. Something like the solo system has already been revealed much earlier and is still a big pain point for reviewers going into the game. 

There are things that can definitely be tweaked and many quality of life updates that can be made. Knowing that there has probably been limited play tests it is understandable but should be patched.

Things to improve on includes but not limited to:
1) Map movement speed too slow
2) Command icons are way too small.

              Minion command icon very difficult to notice
              Unable to filter general vs minion
              The solo battle icon on the mid top screen is pretty unnoticeable
              Ability Icon
              Ability cast color blends into the background a bit
             Hot Keys could be explained better (F, 1,2,3, f1 ,F2, space, enter, Z etc)
      Big Map
                  Command Icon on the top left
                               If you haven't played the previous games and didn't know to rank up generals then you won't even notice it up there. Diplomacy also.
                 Some of the automation commands are less noticeable (Button UI)

       Castle options
                  Sub options like constructions are pretty small
                  Unclear how recruiting minion option is located unlike previous versions

3) Bring back Himiko XD. Unless you need to unlock her like the 4th gen
4) You should allow selection of any number DLC character and not recruit all vs recruit non.
5) A lack of a minimap can be a problem
6) Could bring back the yearly tournament feature

The battle system I enjoyed. It lacked things from past generations but I can see good things that could be added to the current system.


If you find it too easy then try hard difficulty and buff minions. Mid campaign the difficulty ramps up but there can definitely be some number tweaks. Level up and recruit higher star minions to help with fights later.
